intro: Hieracium intactum, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are broadly lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early autumn, producing yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale yellow to white ray florets. Hieracium intactum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in moist to moderately dry conditions.
